name: lib/exceptions/exemptyview.js
ExEmptyView
description:
Exception that rises when the partial view is used as if there were neighbors
populating it, whereas there are none.

params.name: source
params.description: The function that throws the exception.

name: lib/exceptions/exjoin.js
ExJoin
description: Exception threw when the joining phase of Spray does not work as intended.

params.name: source
params.description: The name of the function that threw the exception.

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason the joining failed.

name: lib/exceptions/exmessage.js
ExMessage
description: Spray encountered a problem with a message.

params.name: source
params.description: The name of the function that threw.

params.name: message
params.description: The incriminated message.

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason of the throw.

name: lib/exceptions/expeernotfound.js
ExPeerNotFound
description:
Exception that rises when the peer looked for does not exist in the partial
view.

params.name: source
params.description: The function that throw the error.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer if
defined.

name: lib/messages/mexchange.js
MExchange
description: Message requesting an exchange of neighborhood.

params.name: inview
params.description: The identifier of the inview.

name: lib/messages/mjoin.js
MJoin
description: Message sent by a newcommer to its contact when it joins the network.

name: lib/messages/mleave.js
MLeave
description: Message that signals the departure of the sender.

name: lib/partialview.js
PartialView
description:
Structure containing the neighborhood of a peer.
Map of {idPeer => [age_1, age_2.. age_k]} where age_1 <= age_2 <= .. <= age_k

name: oldest
description: Get the oldest peer in the partial view.

unknown.tagValue: {string} The oldest peer in the array.

return.description: The oldest peer in the array.

name: increment
description: Increment the age of the whole partial view

name: add
description: Add the peer to the partial view with an age of 0.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer added to the partial
view.

name: removeYoungest
description: Remove the newest entry of the peer from the partial view.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer to remove from the
partial view.

name: removeOldest
description: Remove the oldest entry of the peer from the partial view.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer to remove from the
partial view.

name: removeAll
description: Remove all entries of the peer from the partial view.

unknown.tagValue: {number} The number of occurrences of peerId removed.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer to remove from the
partial view.

return.description: The number of occurrences of peerId removed.

name: leastFrequent
description:
Get the least frequent peer. If multiple peers have the same number of
occurrences, it chooses one among them at random.

unknown.tagValue: {string} The identifier of a least frequent peer.

return.description: The identifier of a least frequent peer.

name: lib/spray.js
Spray
description: Implementation of the random peer-sampling Spray.

name: constructor
description: You can pass other parameters such as webrtc options

params.name: options
params.description: Object with all options

params.name: options.pid
params.description:
The identifier of this
protocol.

params.name: options.delta
params.description:
Every delta milliseconds, Spray shuffles
its partial view with its oldest neighbor.

params.name: options.a
params.description:
The number of arcs at each peer converges
to a*log(N) + b, where N is the number of peers in the network.

params.name: options.b
params.description: See above.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the peer that sent the message.

params.name: message
params.description: The message received.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the new neighbor.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the removed arc.

name: join
description: Joining a network.

unknown.tagValue:
{Promise} A promise that is resolved when the peer joins the
network -- the resolve contains the peerId; rejected after a timeout, or
already connected state.

params.name: sender
params.description:
Function that will be called each time an offer
arrives to this peer. It is the responsability of the caller to send
these offer (using sender) to the contact inside the network.

return.description:
A promise that is resolved when the peer joins the
network -- the resolve contains the peerId; rejected after a timeout, or
already connected state.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the newcomer.

name: leave
description:
Leave the network. If time is given, it tries to patch the network before
leaving.

params.name: time
params.description:
The time (in milliseconds) given to this peer
to patch the network before trully leaving.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the peer that just left.

name: getPeers
description:
Get k neighbors from the partial view. If k is not reached, it tries to
fill the gap with neighbors from the inview.  It is worth noting that
each peer controls its outview but not its inview. The more the neigbhors
from the outview the better.

params.name: k
params.description:
The number of neighbors requested. If k is not defined,
it returns every known identifiers of the partial view.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the oldest neighbor chosen to
perform a view exchange.

return.description:
An array containing the identifiers of neighbors from
this partial view.

params.name: neighbor
params.description:
The identifier of the peer that sent this
exchange request.

params.name: message
params.description:
message containing the identifier of the peer
that started the exchange.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the peer that seems down.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer we failed to
establish a connection with. Null if it was yet to be known.

params.name: a
params.description: a * log

params.name: b
params.description: + b

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the peer to duplicate.

content:
# spray-wrtc [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/RAN3D/spray-wrtc.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/RAN3D/spray-wrtc) [![JavaScript Style Guide](https://img.shields.io/badge/code_style-standard-brightgreen.svg)](https://standardjs.com) Keywords: Random peer-sampling, adaptive, browser-to-browser communication, WebRTC This project aims to provide a [WebRTC](http://www.webrtc.org) implementation of Spray. Spray [1] is a random peer-sampling protocol [2] inspired by both Cyclon [3] and Scamp [4]. It adapts the partial view of each member to the network size using local knowledge only. Therefore, without any configuration, each peer automatically adjust its functioning to the need of the network. ## Principle

Peers joining the network inject a logarithmic number of arcs with them. Thus, a 10-peers network has on average 2.3 connections per peer, a 100-peers network has on average 4.6 connections per peer, a 1000 peers network has on average 6.9 connections per peer etc. Consequently, the number of connections scales well in terms of number of peers. The figure shows that peers are highly clustered. Furthermore, the oldest peers have many outgoing arcs while the newest only has one outgoing arc. To solve this issue, the peers must periodically shuffle their partial view of the network.

Periodically, a peer chooses one of its neighbor to exchange with. Both peers provide half of their partial view comprising neighbors chosen at random. Both peers disconnect from the neighbors they provided and connect to the neighbors they obtained. Periodic shufflings balance the outgoing arcs among the peers. The resulting network has a low clustering coefficient. ## Installation ```$ npm install spray-wrtc``` ## API You can find the API [here](https://ran3d.github.io/spray-wrtc/). ## Example A usage example of this module is available [here](https://ran3d.github.io/spray-wrtc/example/browser.html). ## Miscellaneous Peersim [5] simulations of Spray are available at [peersim-spray](https://github.com/justayak/peersim-spray). ## References [1] B. NÃ©delec, J. Tanke, D. Frey, P. Molli, and A. MostÃ©faoui. Spray: an Adaptive Random Peer Sampling Protocol. Technical Report, LINA-University of Nantes; INRIA Rennes - Bretagne Atlantique, Sept 2015. [2] M. Jelasity, S. Voulgaris, R. Guerraoui, A.-M. Kermarrec, and M. Van Steen. Gossip-based peer sampling. ACM Transactions on Computer Systems (TOCS), 25(3):8, 2007. [3] S. Voulgaris, D. Gavidia, and M. van Steen. Cyclon: Inexpensive membership management for unstructured p2p overlays. Journal of Network and Systems Management, 13(2):197â€“217, 2005. [4] A. Ganesh, A.-M. Kermarrec, and L. MassouliÃ©. Peer-to-peer membership management for gossip-based protocols. IEEE Transactions on Computers, 52(2):139â€“149, Feb 2003. [5] A. Montresor and M. Jelasity. Peersim: A scalable P2P simulator. Proc. of the 9th Int. Conference on Peer-to-Peer (P2Pâ€™09), pages 99â€“100, Seattle, WA, Sept. 2009.
name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "spray-wrtc",
  "version": "2.0.11",
  "author": "Chat-Wane <grumpy.chat.wane@gmail.com>",
  "description": "Adaptive random peer-sampling protocol running on top of WebRTC",
  "main": "./lib/spray.js",
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "https://github.com/ran3d/spray-wrtc"
  },
  "keywords": [
    "Random peer-sampling",
    "Adaptive",
    "browser-to-browser communication",
    "WebRTC"
  ],
  "dependencies": {
    "debug": "^3.1.0",
    "lodash": "^4.17.10",
    "n2n-overlay-wrtc": "2.0.x"
  },
  "bundledDependencies": [
    "lodash",
    "debug",
    "n2n-overlay-wrtc"
  ],
  "devDependencies": {
    "browserify": "^16.2.2",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-ecmascript-proposal-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-node": "^1.0.3",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "p2p-graph": "^1.2.2",
    "snazzy": "^7.1.1",
    "standard": "*"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "lint": "standard --verbose | snazzy",
    "fix": "standard --fix",
    "debug": "browserify -r ./lib/spray.js:spray-wrtc --debug > build/spray-wrtc.bundle.debug.js",
    "build": "browserify -r ./lib/spray.js:spray-wrtc > build/spray-wrtc.bundle.js",
    "esdoc": "esdoc && npm run esdoc:example",
    "esdoc:example": "cp -R ./build ./examples ./img ./docs",
    "test": "npm run all",
    "all": "npm run debug && npm run build && npm run esdoc"
  },
  "license": "MIT",
  "standard": {
    "ignore": [
      "/build/",
      "/img/",
      "/examples/"
    ]
  }
}
name: package.json
